verses.text:
Blessed \add is\add* the man that walketh not in the counsel
of the ungodly, nor standeth in the way of sinners, nor sitteth in the
seat of the scornful.\f + \fr 1.1  \ft ungodly: or, wicked\f* 
\q1

And he shall be like a tree planted by the rivers of water,
that bringeth forth his fruit in his season; his leaf also shall not
wither; and whatsoever he doeth shall prosper.\f + \fr 1.3  \ft wither: Heb.
fade\f* 
\b
\q1

The ungodly \add are\add* not so: but \add are\add* like the
chaff which the wind driveth away. 
\q1

Therefore the ungodly shall not stand in the judgment, nor
sinners in the congregation of the righteous. 
\q1

For the \nd LORD\nd* knoweth the way of the righteous: but the
way of the ungodly shall perish.

Why do the heathen rage, and the people imagine a vain thing?\f + \fr 2.1 
\ft rage: or, tumultuously assemble\f*\f + \fr 2.1  \ft imagine: Heb.
meditate\f* 
\q1

The kings of the earth set themselves, and the rulers take
counsel together, against the \nd LORD\nd*, and against his anointed,
\add saying\add*, 
\q1

Let us break their bands asunder, and cast away their cords from us.
\q1

He that sitteth in the heavens shall laugh: the Lord shall have them in
derision. 
\q1

Then shall he speak unto them in his wrath, and vex them in his sore
displeasure.\f + \fr 2.5  \ft vex: or, trouble\f* 
\q1

Yet have I set my king upon my holy hill of Zion.\f + \fr 2.6 
\ft set: Heb. anointed\f*\f + \fr 2.6  \ft upon…: Heb. upon Zion, the hill of my
holiness\f* 
\b
\q1

I will declare the decree: the \nd LORD\nd* hath said unto me, Thou
\add art\add* my Son; this day have I begotten thee.\f + \fr 2.7 
\ft the decree: or, for a decree\f* 
\q1

Ask of me, and I shall give \add thee\add* the heathen \add for\add*
thine inheritance, and the uttermost parts of the earth \add for\add*
thy possession. 
\q1

Thou shalt break them with a rod of iron; thou shalt dash them in
pieces like a potter’s vessel. 
\b
\q1

Be wise now therefore, O ye kings: be instructed, ye judges
of the earth. 
\q1

Serve the \nd LORD\nd* with fear, and rejoice with trembling.
\q1

Kiss the Son, lest he be angry, and ye perish \add from\add*
the way, when his wrath is kindled but a little. Blessed \add are\add*
all they that put their trust in him.

\d A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son. 
\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, how are they increased that trouble me! many
\add are\add* they that rise up against me. 
\q1

Many \add there be\add* which say of my soul, \add There is\add*
no help for him in God. Selah. 
\q1

But thou, O \nd LORD\nd*, \add art\add* a shield for me; my
glory, and the lifter up of mine head.\f + \fr 3.3  \ft for: or,
about\f* 
\b
\q1

I cried unto the \nd LORD\nd* with my voice, and he heard me out of his
holy hill. Selah. 
\q1

I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the \nd LORD\nd* sustained me.
\q1

I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have
set \add themselves\add* against me round about. 
\q1

Arise, O \nd LORD\nd*; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten
all mine enemies \add upon\add* the cheek bone; thou hast broken
the teeth of the ungodly. 
\q1

Salvation \add belongeth\add* unto the \nd LORD\nd*: thy blessing
\add is\add* upon thy people. Selah.

\d To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

Hear me when I call, O God of my righteousness: thou hast enlarged me
\add when I was\add* in distress; have mercy upon me, and hear my
prayer.\f + \fr 4.1  \ft chief…: or, overseer\f*\f + \fr 4.1  \ft have…: or, be gracious unto
me\f* 
\q1

O ye sons of men, how long \add will ye turn\add* my glory
into shame? \add how long\add* will ye love vanity, \add and\add*
seek after leasing? Selah. 
\q1

But know that the 
d LORD
d* hath set apart him that is godly
for himself: the 
d LORD
d* will hear when I call unto him. 
\q1

Stand in awe, and sin not: commune with your own heart upon your
bed, and be still. Selah. 
\q1

Offer the sacrifices of righteousness, and put your trust in the
\nd LORD\nd*. 
\b
\q1

\add There be\add* many that say, Who will shew us \add any\add*
good? \nd LORD\nd*, lift thou up the light of thy countenance upon us.
\q1

Thou hast put gladness in my heart, more than in the time \add that\add*
their corn and their wine increased. 
\q1

I will both lay me down in peace, and sleep: for thou, \nd LORD\nd*,
only makest me dwell in safety.

\d To the chief Musician upon Nehiloth, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

Give ear to my words, O \nd LORD\nd*, consider my meditation.
\q1

Hearken unto the voice of my cry, my King, and my God: for unto thee will I
pray. 
\q1

My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O \nd LORD\nd*; in the
morning will I direct \add my prayer\add* unto thee, and will look
up. 
\q1

For thou \add art\add* not a God that hath pleasure in wickedness:
neither shall evil dwell with thee. 
\q1

The foolish shall not stand in thy sight: thou hatest all workers
of iniquity.\f + \fr 5.5  \ft in…: Heb. before thine eyes\f* 
\q1

Thou shalt destroy them that speak leasing: the \nd LORD\nd*
will abhor the bloody and deceitful man.\f + \fr 5.6  \ft bloody…: Heb. man of bloods and
deceit\f* 
\b
\q1

But as for me, I will come \add into\add* thy house in the
multitude of thy mercy: \add and\add* in thy fear will I worship
toward thy holy temple.\f + \fr 5.7  \ft thy holy…: Heb. the temple of thy
holiness\f* 
\q1

Lead me, O \nd LORD\nd*, in thy righteousness because of mine
enemies; make thy way straight before my face.\f + \fr 5.8  \ft mine…: Heb. those which observe
me\f* 
\q1

For \add there is\add* no faithfulness in their mouth; their
inward part \add is\add* very wickedness; their throat \add is\add*
an open sepulchre; they flatter with their tongue.\f + \fr 5.9  \ft faithfulness: or,
stedfastness\f*\f + \fr 5.9  \ft their mouth: Heb. his mouth, that is, the mouth of any of
them\f*\f + \fr 5.9  \ft very…: Heb. wickednesses\f* 
\q1

Destroy thou them, O God; let them fall by their own counsels;
cast them out in the multitude of their transgressions; for they have
rebelled against thee.\f + \fr 5.10  \ft Destroy…: or, Make them
guilty\f*\f + \fr 5.10  \ft by…: or, from their counsels\f* 
\q1

But let all those that put their trust in thee rejoice: let them
ever shout for joy, because thou defendest them: let them also that
love thy name be joyful in thee.\f + \fr 5.11  \ft defendest…: Heb. coverest over, or, protectest
them\f* 
\q1

For thou, \nd LORD\nd*, wilt bless the righteous; with favour
wilt thou compass him as \add with\add* a shield.\f + \fr 5.12  \ft compass: Heb.
crown\f*

\d To the chief Musician on Neginoth upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David.
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd*, rebuke me not in thine anger, neither chasten
me in thy hot displeasure.\f + \fr 6.1  \ft chief…: or, overseer\f*\f + \fr 6.1 
\ft Sheminith: or, the eighth\f* 
\q1

Have mercy upon me, O 
d LORD
d*; for I \add am\add* weak:
O 
d LORD
d*, heal me; for my bones are vexed. 
\q1

My soul is also sore vexed: but thou, O \nd LORD\nd*, how long?
\q1

Return, O \nd LORD\nd*, deliver my soul: oh save me for thy
mercies’ sake. 
\q1

For in death \add there is\add* no remembrance of thee: in the
grave who shall give thee thanks? 
\q1

I am weary with my groaning; all the night make I my bed to
swim; I water my couch with my tears.\f + \fr 6.6  \ft all…: or, every
night\f* 
\q1

Mine eye is consumed because of grief; it waxeth old because of all mine
enemies. 
\b
\q1

Depart from me, all ye workers of iniquity; for the \nd LORD\nd*
hath heard the voice of my weeping. 
\q1

The 
d LORD
d* hath heard my supplication; the 
d LORD
d*
will receive my prayer. 
\q1

Let all mine enemies be ashamed and sore vexed: let them return
\add and\add* be ashamed suddenly.

\d Shiggaion of David, which he sang unto the \nd LORD\nd*, concerning the
words of Cush the Benjamite. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* my God, in thee do I put my trust: save me from all them that
persecute me, and deliver me:\f + \fr 7.1  \ft words: or, business\f*
\q1

Lest he tear my soul like a lion, rending \add it\add* in pieces, while
\add there is\add* none to deliver.\f + \fr 7.2  \ft none…: Heb. not a
deliverer\f* 
\q1

If I have rewarded evil unto him that was at peace with me; (yea, I have
delivered him that without cause is mine enemy:) 
\q1

Let the enemy persecute my soul, and take \add it;\add* yea, let him tread
down my life upon the earth, and lay mine honour in the dust. Selah.
\q1

Arise, O \nd LORD\nd*, in thine anger, lift up thyself because of the
rage of mine enemies: and awake for me \add to\add* the judgment
\add that\add* thou hast commanded. 
\q1

So shall the congregation of the people compass thee about:
for their sakes therefore return thou on high. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* shall judge the people: judge me, O \nd LORD\nd*,
according to my righteousness, and according to mine integrity \add that
is\add* in me. 
\q1

Oh let the wickedness of the wicked come to an end; but establish
the just: for the righteous God trieth the hearts and reins. 
\b
\q1

My defence \add is\add* of God, which saveth the upright in
heart.\f + \fr 7.10  \ft My…: Heb. My buckler is upon God\f* 
\q1

God judgeth the righteous, and God is angry \add with the
wicked\add* every day.\f + \fr 7.11  \ft judgeth…: or, is a righteous
judge\f* 
\q1

He hath also prepared for him the instruments of death; he
ordaineth his arrows against the persecutors. 
\q1

Behold, he travaileth with iniquity, and hath conceived mischief,
and brought forth falsehood. 
\q1

He made a pit, and digged it, and is fallen into the ditch
\add which\add* he made.\f + \fr 7.15  \ft He made a pit: Heb. He hath digged a
pit\f* 
\q1

His mischief shall return upon his own head, and his violent
dealing shall come down upon his own pate. 
\q1

I will praise the 
d LORD
d* according to his righteousness:
and will sing praise to the name of the 
d LORD
d* most high.

\d To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* our Lord, how excellent \add is\add* thy name
in all the earth! who hast set thy glory above the heavens. 
\q1

Out of the mouth of babes and sucklings hast thou ordained
strength because of thine enemies, that thou mightest still the enemy
and the avenger.\f + \fr 8.2  \ft ordained: Heb. founded\f* 
\b
\q1

What is man, that thou art mindful of him? and the son of man,
that thou visitest him? 
\q1

For thou hast made him a little lower than the angels, and hast
crowned him with glory and honour. 
\q1

All sheep and oxen, yea, and the beasts of the field;\f + \fr 8.7 
\ft All…: Heb. Flocks and oxen all of them\f* 
\q1

The fowl of the air, and the fish of the sea, \add and whatsoever\add*
passeth through the paths of the seas. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* our Lord, how excellent \add is\add* thy name
in all the earth!

\d To the chief Musician upon Muthlabben, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

I will praise \add thee\add*, O \nd LORD\nd*, with my whole
heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works. 
\q1

I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy
name, O thou most High. 
\q1

When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish
at thy presence. 
\q1

For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest
in the throne judging  right.\f + \fr 9.4  \ft maintained…: Heb. made my
judgment\f*\f + \fr 9.4  \ft judging right: Heb. judging in righteousness\f*
\q1

Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked,
thou hast put out their name for ever and ever. 
\q1

O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast
destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.\f + \fr 9.6 
\ft O thou…: or, The destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetual end: and their cities hast thou destroyed,
etc\f* 
\q1

But the \nd LORD\nd* shall endure for ever: he hath prepared
his throne for judgment. 
\q1

And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister
judgment to the people in uprightness. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a
refuge in times of trouble.\f + \fr 9.9  \ft a refuge: Heb. an high
place\f* 
\q1

And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou,
\nd LORD\nd*, hast not forsaken them that seek thee. 
\b
\q1

Sing praises to the \nd LORD\nd*, which dwelleth in Zion:
declare among the people his doings. 
\q1

When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he
forgetteth not the cry of the humble.\f + \fr 9.12  \ft humble: or,
afflicted\f* 
\q1

Have mercy upon me, O \nd LORD\nd*; consider my trouble \add which I
suffer\add* of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the
gates of death: 
\q1

That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter
of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation. 
\q1

The heathen are sunk down in the pit \add that\add* they made:
in the net which they hid is their own foot taken. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* is known \add by\add* the judgment \add which\add*
he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands.
Higgaion. Selah.\f + \fr 9.16  \ft Higgaion: that is, Meditation\f*
\q1

The wicked shall be turned into hell, \add and\add* all the
nations that forget God. 
\q1

For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation
of the poor shall \add not\add* perish for ever. 
\q1

Arise, O \nd LORD\nd*; let not man prevail: let the heathen
be judged in thy sight. 
\q1

Put them in fear, O \nd LORD\nd*: \add that\add* the nations
may know themselves \add to be but\add* men. Selah.

Why standest thou afar off, O \nd LORD\nd*? \add why\add* hidest thou
\add thyself\add* in times of trouble? 
\q1

The wicked in \add his\add* pride doth persecute the poor:
let them be taken in the devices that they have imagined.\f + \fr 10.2 
\ft The wicked…: Heb. In the pride of the wicked he doth persecute\f*
\q1

For the wicked boasteth of his heart’s desire, and blesseth
the covetous, \add whom\add* the \nd LORD\nd* abhorreth.\f + \fr 10.3 
\ft heart’s: Heb. soul’s\f*\f + \fr 10.3  \ft blesseth…: or, the covetous blesseth himself, he abhorreth the
\+nd LORD\+nd*\f* 
\q1

The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not
seek \add after God:\add* God \add is\add* not in all his thoughts.\f + \fr 10.4 
\ft God is…: or, all his thoughts are, There is no God\f* 
\q1

His ways are always grievous; thy judgments \add are\add* far
above out of his sight: \add as for\add* all his enemies, he puffeth at them.
\q1

He hath said in his heart, I shall not be moved: for \add I
shall\add* never \add be\add* in adversity.\f + \fr 10.6  \ft never: Heb. unto generation and
generation\f* 
\q1

His mouth is full of cursing and deceit and fraud: under his
tongue \add is\add* mischief and vanity.\f + \fr 10.7  \ft deceit: Heb.
deceits\f*\f + \fr 10.7  \ft vanity: or, iniquity\f* 
\q1

He sitteth in the lurking places of the villages: in the secret
places doth he murder the innocent: his eyes are privily set against the
poor.\f + \fr 10.8  \ft are…: Heb. hide themselves\f* 
\q1

He lieth in wait secretly as a lion in his den: he lieth in
wait to catch the poor: he doth catch the poor, when he draweth him into his
net.\f + \fr 10.9  \ft secretly: Heb. in the secret places\f* 
\q1

He croucheth, \add and\add* humbleth himself, that the poor
may fall by his strong ones.\f + \fr 10.10  \ft He…: Heb. He breaketh
himself\f*\f + \fr 10.10  \ft by…: or, into his strong parts\f* 
\q1

He hath said in his heart, God hath forgotten: he hideth his
face; he will never see \add it\add*. 
\b
\q1

Arise, O \nd LORD\nd*; O God, lift up thine hand: forget not the
humble.\f + \fr 10.12  \ft humble: or, afflicted\f* 
\q1

Wherefore doth the wicked contemn God? he hath said in his
heart, Thou wilt not require \add it\add*. 
\q1

Thou hast seen \add it;\add* for thou beholdest mischief and
spite, to requite \add it\add* with thy hand: the poor committeth
himself unto thee; thou art the helper of the fatherless.\f + \fr 10.14 
\ft committeth: Heb. leaveth\f* 
\q1

Break thou the arm of the wicked and the evil \add man:\add*
seek out his wickedness \add till\add* thou find none. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* King for ever and ever: the
heathen are perished out of his land. 
\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, thou hast heard the desire of the humble: thou wilt
prepare their heart, thou wilt cause thine ear to hear:\f + \fr 10.17 
\ft prepare: or, establish\f* 
\q1

To judge the fatherless and the oppressed, that the man of the
earth may no more oppress.\f + \fr 10.18  \ft oppress: or, terrify\f*

\d To the chief Musician, \add A Psalm\add* of David. 
\q1

In the \nd LORD\nd* put I my trust: how say ye to my soul,
Flee \add as\add* a bird to your mountain? 
\q1

For, lo, the wicked bend \add their\add* bow, they make ready
their arrow upon the string, that they may privily shoot at the upright
in heart.\f + \fr 11.2  \ft privily: Heb. in darkness\f* 
\q1

If the foundations be destroyed, what can the righteous do?
\b
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* in his holy temple, the \nd LORD’s\nd*
throne \add is\add* in heaven: his eyes behold, his eyelids try,
the children of men. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* trieth the righteous: but the wicked and him that
loveth violence his soul hateth. 
\q1

Upon the wicked he shall rain snares, fire and brimstone, and an
horrible tempest: \add this shall be\add* the portion of their cup.\f + \fr 11.6 
\ft an horrible…: or, a burning tempest\f* 
\q1

For the righteous \nd LORD\nd* loveth righteousness; his countenance
doth behold the upright.

\d To the chief Musician upon Sheminith, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

Help, \nd LORD\nd*; for the godly man ceaseth; for the faithful
fail from among the children of men.\f + \fr 12.1  \ft upon…: or, upon the
eighth\f*\f + \fr 12.1  \ft Help: or, Save\f* 
\q1

They speak vanity every one with his neighbour: \add with\add*
flattering lips \add and\add* with a double heart do they speak.\f + \fr 12.2 
\ft a double…: Heb. an heart and an heart\f* 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* shall cut off all flattering lips, \add and\add*
the tongue that speaketh proud things:\f + \fr 12.3  \ft proud: Heb.
great\f* 
\q1

Who have said, With our tongue will we prevail; our lips \add are\add* our own: who
\add is\add* lord over us?\f + \fr 12.4  \ft are…: Heb. are with
us\f* 
\q1

For the oppression of the poor, for the sighing of the needy,
now will I arise, saith the \nd LORD\nd*; I will set \add him\add*
in safety \add from him that\add* puffeth at him.\f + \fr 12.5  \ft puffeth…: or, would ensnare
him\f* 
\q1

The words of the \nd LORD\nd* \add are\add* pure words: \add as\add*
silver tried in a furnace of earth, purified seven times. 
\q1

Thou shalt keep them, O \nd LORD\nd*, thou shalt preserve them from
this generation for ever.\f + \fr 12.7  \ft them from: Heb. him, etc: that is, every one of them,
etc\f* 
\q1

The wicked walk on every side, when the vilest men are exalted.\f + \fr 12.8 
\ft men: Heb. of the sons of the men\f*

\d To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

How long wilt thou forget me, O \nd LORD\nd*? for ever? how long wilt thou
hide thy face from me?\f + \fr 13.1  \ft chief…: or, overseer\f*
\q1

How long shall I take counsel in my soul, \add having\add*
sorrow in my heart daily? how long shall mine enemy be exalted over me?
\q1

Lest mine enemy say, I have prevailed against him; \add and\add*
those that trouble me rejoice when I am moved. 
\q1

But I have trusted in thy mercy; my heart shall rejoice in thy
salvation. 
\q1
I will sing unto the \nd LORD\nd*, because he hath dealt bountifully with me.

\d To the chief Musician, \add A Psalm\add* of David. 
\q1

The fool hath said in his heart, \add There is\add* no God.
They are corrupt, they have done abominable works, \add there is\add*
none that doeth good. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* looked down from heaven upon the children
of men, to see if there were any that did understand, \add and\add*
seek God. 
\q1

They are all gone aside, they are \add all\add* together become
filthy: \add there is\add* none that doeth good, no, not one.\f + \fr 14.3 
\ft filthy: Heb. stinking\f* 
\b
\q1

Have all the workers of iniquity no knowledge? who eat up my
people \add as\add* they eat bread, and call not upon the \nd LORD\nd*.
\q1

There were they in great fear: for God \add is\add* in the
generation of the righteous.\f + \fr 14.5  \ft were…: Heb. they feared a
fear\f* 
\q1

Ye have shamed the counsel of the poor, because the \nd LORD\nd*
\add is\add* his refuge. 
\q1

Oh that the salvation of Israel \add were come\add* out of
Zion! when the \nd LORD\nd* bringeth back the captivity of his people,
Jacob shall rejoice, \add and\add* Israel shall be glad.\f + \fr 14.7 
\ft Oh…: Heb. Who will give\f*

\nd LORD\nd*, who shall abide in thy tabernacle? who shall
dwell in thy holy hill?\f + \fr 15.1  \ft abide: Heb. sojourn\f*
\q1

He that walketh uprightly, and worketh righteousness, and speaketh
the truth in his heart. 
\q1

\add He that\add* backbiteth not with his tongue, nor doeth
evil to his neighbour, nor taketh up a reproach against his neighbour.\f + \fr 15.3 
\ft taketh…: or, receiveth, or, endureth\f* 
\q1

In whose eyes a vile person is contemned; but he honoureth
them that fear the \nd LORD\nd*. \add He that\add* sweareth to \add his
own\add* hurt, and changeth not. 
\q1

\add He that\add* putteth not out his money to usury, nor taketh
reward against the innocent. He that doeth these \add things\add*
shall never be moved.

\d Michtam of David. 
\q1

Preserve me, O God: for in thee do I put my trust.\f + \fr 16.1 
\ft Michtam: or, A golden Psalm\f* 
\q1

\add But\add* to the saints that \add are\add* in the earth, and
\add to\add* the excellent, in whom \add is\add* all my delight.
\q1

Their sorrows shall be multiplied \add that\add* hasten \add after\add*
another \add god:\add* their drink offerings of blood will I not
offer, nor take up their names into my lips.\f + \fr 16.4  \ft hasten…: or, give gifts to
another\f* 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* the portion of mine inheritance
and of my cup: thou maintainest my lot.\f + \fr 16.5  \ft of mine…: Heb. of my
part\f* 
\q1

The lines are fallen unto me in pleasant \add places;\add*
yea, I have a goodly heritage. 
\q1

I will bless the \nd LORD\nd*, who hath given me counsel: my
reins also instruct me in the night seasons. 
\b
\q1

I have set the \nd LORD\nd* always before me: because \add he
is\add* at my right hand, I shall not be moved. 
\q1

Therefore my heart is glad, and my glory rejoiceth: my flesh
also shall rest in hope.\f + \fr 16.9  \ft rest…: Heb. dwell confidently\f*
\q1

For thou wilt not leave my soul in hell; neither wilt thou

\q1

\d To the chief Musician, \add A Psalm\add* of David, the servant

d LORD
d*, who spake unto the 
d LORD

\q1

\q1

Therefore hath the \nd LORD\nd* recompensed me according to my

With the pure thou wilt shew thyself pure; and with the froward

\q1

For thou wilt save the afflicted people; but wilt bring down

\q1

For thou wilt light my candle: the \nd LORD\nd* my God will

\q1

For by thee I have run through a troop; and by my God have I leaped

\q1

\add As for\add* God, his way \add is\add* perfect: the word

\q1

For who \add is\add* God save the \nd LORD\nd*? or who \add is\add*

\q1

\add It is\add* God that girdeth me with strength, and maketh
my way perfect. 
\q1

He maketh my feet like hinds’ \add feet\add*, and setteth

\q1

He teacheth my hands to war, so that a bow of steel is broken

\q1

Thou hast also given me the shield of thy salvation: and thy right

Thou hast enlarged my steps under me, that my feet did not

\q1

\q1

Thou hast also given me the necks of mine enemies; that I might

They cried, but \add there was\add* none to save \add them:

Thou hast delivered me from the strivings of the people; \add and\add*

\add It is\add* God that avengeth me, and subdueth the people under

\q1

\q1

\add There is\add* no speech nor language, \add where\add*

\d To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* hear thee in the day of trouble; the name

\q1

\d To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

The king shall joy in thy strength, O \nd LORD\nd*; and in thy

\q1

\q1

\q1

\d A Psalm of David. 
\q1

\q1

Lift up your heads, O ye gates; and be ye lift up, ye everlasting

Who \add is\add* this King of glory? The 
d LORD
d* strong
and mighty, the 
d LORD
d* mighty in battle.

\d \add A Psalm\add* of David. 
\q1

Unto thee, O \nd LORD\nd*, do I lift up my soul. 
\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

One \add thing\add* have I desired of the

d LORD
d*, and to

\add I had fainted\add*, unless I had believed to see the

Wait on the 
d LORD
d*: be of good courage, and he shall

\q1

The voice of the 
d LORD

\q1

The voice of the 
d LORD
d* shaketh the wilderness; the 
d LORD
d*

\q1

The 
d LORD
d* sitteth upon the flood; yea, the 
d LORD
d*

\q1

The 
d LORD

d*

d LORD

d LORD

d LORD

d LORD

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

For \add such as be\add* blessed of him shall inherit the earth; and

\q1

\q1

\b
\q1

\q1

I have seen the wicked in great power, and spreading himself like a

\q1

Yet he passed away, and, lo, he \add was\add* not: yea, I

\q1

\q1

O \nd LORD\nd*, rebuke me not in thy wrath: neither chasten

\q1

\q1

\add There is\add* no soundness in my flesh because of thine

\q1

\q1

My heart panteth, my strength faileth me: as for the light

\q1

My lovers and my friends stand aloof from my sore; and my

\b
\q1

They also that seek after my life lay snares \add for me:\add*

\q1

But I, as a deaf \add man\add*, heard not; and \add I was\add*

For I said, \add Hear me\add*, lest \add otherwise\add* they should

For I \add am\add* ready to halt, and my sorrow \add is\add*

\q1

For I will declare mine iniquity; I will be sorry for my sin.

But mine enemies \add are\add* lively, \add and\add* they are

\q1

Forsake me not, O \nd LORD\nd*: O my God, be not far from me.
\q1

\d To the chief Musician, \add even\add* to Jeduthun, A Psalm of

Behold, thou hast made my days \add as\add* an handbreadth;

\ft at…: Heb. settled\f* 
\q1

Surely every man walketh in a vain shew: surely they are disquieted

\b
\q1

And now, Lord, what wait I for? my hope \add is\add* in thee.
\q1

Deliver me from all my transgressions: make me not the reproach

\q1

I was dumb, I opened not my mouth; because thou didst \add it\add*.

Remove thy stroke away from me: I am consumed by the blow

Hear my prayer, O \nd LORD\nd*, and give ear unto my cry;

\q1

Many, O \nd LORD\nd* my God, \add are\add* thy wonderful works

\q1

Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou

\q1

Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book \add it

I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not

\q1

Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O \nd LORD\nd*:

For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities

\q1

Be pleased, O 
d LORD
d*, to deliver me: O 
d LORD
d*,
make haste to help me. 
\q1

Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my

\q1

Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say

\q1

Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as

But I \add am\add* poor and needy; \add yet\add* the Lord thinketh upon me: thou

The \nd LORD\nd* will preserve him, and keep him alive; \add and\add*

I said, \nd LORD\nd*, be merciful unto me: heal my soul; for I have

\q1

\q1

And if he come to see \add me\add*, he speaketh vanity: his

All that hate me whisper together against me: against me do they

Yea, mine own familiar friend, in whom I trusted, which did

\q1

But thou, O \nd LORD\nd*, be merciful unto me, and raise me

\q1

By this I know that thou favourest me, because mine enemy

\q1

And as for me, thou upholdest me in mine integrity, and settest

\q1

Blessed \add be\add* the \nd LORD\nd* God of Israel from everlasting,

\d To the chief Musician, Maschil, for the sons of Korah. 
\q1

As the hart panteth after the water brooks, so panteth my soul

\b
\q1

\add As\add* with a sword in my bones, mine enemies reproach

\q1

Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted

\q1

For thou \add art\add* the God of my strength: why dost thou cast me

\q1

\q1

\q1

Why art thou cast down, O my soul? and why art thou disquieted

\d To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, Maschil. 
\q1

We have heard with our ears, O God, our fathers have told us,

\q1

\q1

Thou art my King, O God: command deliverances for Jacob. 
\q1

Through thee will we push down our enemies: through thy name

\q1

For I will not trust in my bow, neither shall my sword save me.
\q1

But thou hast saved us from our enemies, and hast put them to

\q1

\b
\q1

But thou hast cast off, and put us to shame; and goest not

\q1

Thou makest us to turn back from the enemy: and they which

\q1

Thou hast given us like sheep \add appointed\add* for meat;

\q1

Thou sellest thy people for nought, and dost not increase

\q1

Thou makest us a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and a

\q1

My confusion \add is\add* continually before me, and the shame

\q1

\q1

\q1

Awake, why sleepest thou, O Lord? arise, cast \add us\add*

\q1

Wherefore hidest thou thy face, \add and\add* forgettest our

\q1

\q1

Arise for our help, and redeem us for thy mercies’ sake.\f + \fr 44.26

\d To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim, for the sons of Korah,

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

The king’s daughter \add is\add* all glorious within: her

\q1

\q1

\q1

\d To the chief Musician for the sons of Korah, A Song upon Alamoth.
\q1

\q1

\add There is\add* a river, the streams whereof shall make

\q1

God \add is\add* in the midst of her; she shall not be moved:

\b
\q1

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* of hosts \add is\add* with us; the God of

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* of hosts \add is\add* with us; the God of

\q1

For the \nd LORD\nd* most high \add is\add* terrible; \add he

\q1

\q1

\b
\q1

God is gone up with a shout, the \nd LORD\nd* with the sound

\q1

For God \add is\add* the King of all the earth: sing ye praises

\q1

\q1

The princes of the people are gathered together, \add even\add*

God of Abraham\f*

\d A Song \add and\add* Psalm for the sons of Korah. 
\q1

Great \add is\add* the \nd LORD\nd*, and greatly to be praised

\q1

\q1

\b
\q1

As we have heard, so have we seen in the city of the \nd LORD\nd*

\q1

\q1

According to thy name, O God, so \add is\add* thy praise unto the

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

Like sheep they are laid in the grave; death shall feed on them; and the

\q1

But God will redeem my soul from the power of the grave: for he shall

\q1

\q1

Though while he lived he blessed his soul: and \add men\add*

\ft while…: Heb. in his life\f* 
\q1

He shall go to the generation of his fathers; they shall never

\q1

The mighty God, \add even\add* the \nd LORD\nd*, hath spoken,

\q1

\b
\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

Behold, thou desirest truth in the inward parts: and in the

\b
\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\b
\q1

As for me, I will call upon God; and the \nd LORD\nd* shall

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

\add The words\add* of his mouth were smoother than butter,

Cast thy burden upon the \nd LORD\nd*, and he shall sustain

\q1

\q1

Do ye indeed speak righteousness, O congregation? do ye judge

\q1

\q1

\q1

Their poison \add is\add* like the poison of a serpent: \add they

\q1

\b
\q1

But as for me, my prayer \add is\add* unto thee, O \nd LORD\nd*,
\add in\add* an acceptable time: O God, in the multitude of thy mercy
hear me, in the truth of thy salvation. 
\q1

Deliver me out of the mire, and let me not sink: let me be
delivered from them that hate me, and out of the deep waters. 
\q1

Let not the waterflood overflow me, neither let the deep swallow me
up, and let not the pit shut her mouth upon me. 
\q1

Hear me, O \nd LORD\nd*; for thy lovingkindness \add is\add*
good: turn unto me according to the multitude of thy tender mercies.
\q1

And hide not thy face from thy servant; for I am in trouble:
hear me speedily.\f + \fr 69.17  \ft hear…: Heb. make haste to hear
me\f* 
\q1

Draw nigh unto my soul, \add and\add* redeem it: deliver me because of mine
enemies. 
\q1

Thou hast known my reproach, and my shame, and my dishonour:
mine adversaries \add are\add* all before thee. 
\q1

Reproach hath broken my heart; and I am full of heaviness:
and I looked \add for some\add* to take pity, but \add there was\add*
none; and for comforters, but I found none.\f + \fr 69.20  \ft to take…: Heb. to lament with
me\f* 
\q1

They gave me also gall for my meat; and in my thirst they gave me
vinegar to drink. 
\b
\q1

Let their table become a snare before them: and \add that which should have
been\add* for \add their\add* welfare, \add let it become\add* a
trap. 
\q1

Let their eyes be darkened, that they see not; and make their
loins continually to shake. 
\q1

Pour out thine indignation upon them, and let thy wrathful
anger take hold of them. 
\q1

Let their habitation be desolate; \add and\add* let none dwell
in their tents.\f + \fr 69.25  \ft their habitation: Heb. their palace\f*\f + \fr 69.25 
\ft let none…: Heb. let there not be a dweller\f* 
\q1

For they persecute \add him\add* whom thou hast smitten; and they
talk to the grief of those whom thou hast wounded.\f + \fr 69.26 
\ft those…: Heb. thy wounded\f* 
\q1

Add iniquity unto their iniquity: and let them not come into thy
righteousness.\f + \fr 69.27  \ft iniquity unto…: or, punishment of iniquity,
etc\f* 
\q1

Let them be blotted out of the book of the living, and not be
written with the righteous. 
\q1

But I \add am\add* poor and sorrowful: let thy salvation, O
God, set me up on high. 
\b
\q1

I will praise the name of God with a song, and will magnify
him with thanksgiving. 
\q1

\add This\add* also shall please the \nd LORD\nd* better than an
ox \add or\add* bullock that hath horns and hoofs. 
\q1

The humble shall see \add this, and\add* be glad: and your
heart shall live that seek God.\f + \fr 69.32  \ft humble: or, meek\f*
\q1

For the \nd LORD\nd* heareth  the poor, and despiseth not his
prisoners. 
\q1

Let the heaven and earth praise him, the seas, and every thing that
moveth therein.\f + \fr 69.34  \ft moveth: Heb. creepeth\f* 
\q1

For God will save Zion, and will build the cities of Judah:
that they may dwell there, and have it in possession. 
\q1

The seed also of his servants shall inherit it: and they that
love his name shall dwell therein.

\d To the chief Musician, \add A Psalm\add* of David, to bring to
remembrance. 
\q1

\add Make haste\add*, O God, to deliver me; make haste to help
me, O \nd LORD\nd*.\f + \fr 70.1  \ft to help…: Heb. to my help\f*
\q1

Let them be ashamed and confounded that seek after my soul:
let them be turned backward, and put to confusion, that desire my
hurt. 
\q1

Let them be turned back for a reward of their shame that say,
Aha, aha. 
\q1

Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: and let such as
love thy salvation say continually, Let God be magnified. 
\q1

But I \add am\add* poor and needy: make haste unto me, O God: thou
\add art\add* my help and my deliverer; O \nd LORD\nd*, make no tarrying.

In thee, O \nd LORD\nd*, do I put my trust: let me never be put to
confusion. 
\q1

Deliver me in thy righteousness, and cause me to escape: incline
thine ear unto me, and save me. 
\q1

Be thou my strong habitation, whereunto I may continually resort:
thou hast given commandment to save me; for thou \add art\add* my
rock and my fortress.\f + \fr 71.3  \ft Be…: Heb. Be thou to me for a rock of
habitation\f* 
\q1

Deliver me, O my God, out of the hand of the wicked, out of the
hand of the unrighteous and cruel man. 
\q1

For thou \add art\add* my hope, O Lord \nd GOD\nd*: \add thou
art\add* my trust from my youth. 
\q1

By thee have I been holden up from the womb: thou art he that
took me out of my mother’s bowels: my praise \add shall be\add* continually of thee.
\q1

I am as a wonder unto many; but thou \add art\add* my strong
refuge. 
\q1

Let my mouth be filled \add with\add* thy praise \add and with\add*
thy honour all the day. 
\q1

Cast me not off in the time of old age; forsake me not when my
strength faileth. 
\q1

For mine enemies speak against me; and they that lay wait
for my soul take counsel together,\f + \fr 71.10  \ft lay…: Heb. watch, or,
observe\f* 
\q1

Saying, God hath forsaken him: persecute and take him; for
\add there is\add* none to deliver \add him\add*. 
\q1

O God, be not far from me: O my God, make haste for my help.
\q1

Let them be confounded \add and\add* consumed that are adversaries
to my soul; let them be covered \add with\add* reproach and dishonour
that seek my hurt. 
\b
\q1

But I will hope continually, and will yet praise thee more
and more. 
\q1

My mouth shall shew forth thy righteousness \add and\add*
thy salvation all the day; for I know not the numbers \add thereof\add*.
\q1

I will go in the strength of the Lord \nd GOD\nd*: I will make
mention of thy righteousness, \add even\add* of thine only. 
\q1

O God, thou hast taught me from my youth: and hitherto have I
declared thy wondrous works. 
\q1

Now also when I am old and grayheaded, O God, forsake me not; until I have
shewed thy strength unto \add this\add* generation, \add and\add*
thy power to every one \add that\add* is to come.\f + \fr 71.18 
\ft when…: Heb. unto old age and gray hairs\f*\f + \fr 71.18  \ft thy strength: Heb. thine
arm\f* 
\q1

Thy righteousness also, O God, \add is\add* very high, who hast
done great things: O God, who \add is\add* like unto thee! 
\q1

\add Thou\add*, which hast shewed me great and sore troubles,
shalt quicken me again, and shalt bring me up again from the depths
of the earth. 
\q1

Thou shalt increase my greatness, and comfort me on every
side. 
\q1

I will also praise thee with the psaltery, \add even\add*
thy truth, O my God: unto thee will I sing with the harp, O thou Holy
One of Israel.\f + \fr 71.22  \ft the psaltery: Heb. the instrument of
psaltery\f* 
\q1

My lips shall greatly rejoice when I sing unto thee; and my
soul, which thou hast redeemed. 
\q1

My tongue also shall talk of thy righteousness all the day
long: for they are confounded, for they are brought unto shame, that
seek my hurt.

\d \add A Psalm\add* for Solomon. 
\q1

Give the king thy judgments, O God, and thy righteousness unto the
king’s son.\f + \fr 72.1  \ft for: or, of\f* 
\b
\q1

He shall judge thy people with righteousness, and thy poor
with judgment. 
\q1

The mountains shall bring peace to the people, and the little
hills, by righteousness. 
\q1

He shall judge the poor of the people, he shall save the children
of the needy, and shall break in pieces the oppressor. 
\q1

They shall fear thee as long as the sun and moon endure, throughout
all generations. 
\q1

He shall come down like rain upon the mown grass: as showers
\add that\add* water the earth. 
\q1

In his days shall the righteous flourish; and abundance of
peace so long as the moon endureth.\f + \fr 72.7  \ft so long…: Heb. till there be no
moon\f* 
\q1

He shall have dominion also from sea to sea, and from the river
unto the ends of the earth. 
\q1

They that dwell in the wilderness shall bow before him; and his
enemies shall lick the dust. 
\q1

The kings of Tarshish and of the isles shall bring presents:
the kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts. 
\q1

Yea, all kings shall fall down before him: all nations shall
serve him. 
\q1

For he shall deliver the needy when he crieth; the poor also, and
\add him\add* that hath no helper. 
\q1

He shall spare the poor and needy, and shall save the souls
of the needy. 
\q1

He shall redeem their soul from deceit and violence: and precious
shall their blood be in his sight. 
\q1

And he shall live, and to him shall be given of the gold of
Sheba: prayer also shall be made for him continually; \add and\add*
daily shall he be praised.\f + \fr 72.15  \ft shall be given: Heb. one shall
give\f* 
\q1

There shall be an handful of corn in the earth upon the top
of the mountains; the fruit thereof shall shake like Lebanon: and
\add they\add* of the city shall flourish like grass of the earth.
\q1

His name shall endure for ever: his name shall be continued
as long as the sun: and \add men\add* shall be blessed in him: all
nations shall call him blessed.\f + \fr 72.17  \ft endure: Heb. be\f*\f + \fr 72.17 
\ft his name shall be…: Heb. shall be as a son to continue his father’s name for
ever\f* 
\b
\q1

Blessed \add be\add* the \nd LORD\nd* God, the God of Israel,
who only doeth wondrous things. 
\q1

And blessed \add be\add* his glorious name for ever: and let the whole
earth be filled \add with\add* his glory; Amen, and Amen. 
\q1

\d A Psalm of Asaph. 
\q1

Truly God \add is\add* good to Israel, \add even\add* to such as are of a
clean heart.\f + \fr 73.1  \ft of: or, for\f*\f + \fr 73.1  \ft Truly: or,
Yet\f*\f + \fr 73.1  \ft of…: Heb. clean of heart\f* 
\q1

But as for me, my feet were almost gone; my steps had well
nigh slipped. 
\q1

For I was envious at the foolish, \add when\add* I saw the
prosperity of the wicked. 
\q1

For \add there are\add* no bands in their death: but their strength
\add is\add* firm.\f + \fr 73.4  \ft firm: Heb. fat\f* 
\q1

They \add are\add* not in trouble \add as other\add* men; neither are they
plagued like \add other\add* men.\f + \fr 73.5  \ft in…: Heb. in the trouble of other
men\f*\f + \fr 73.5  \ft like: Heb. with\f* 
\q1

Therefore pride compasseth them about as a chain; violence
covereth them \add as\add* a garment. 
\q1

Their eyes stand out with fatness: they have more than heart
could wish.\f + \fr 73.7  \ft have…: Heb. pass the thoughts of the
heart\f* 
\q1

They are corrupt, and speak wickedly \add concerning\add* oppression:
they speak loftily. 
\q1

They set their mouth against the heavens, and their tongue
walketh through the earth. 
\q1

Therefore his people return hither: and waters of a full \add cup\add*
are wrung out to them. 
\q1

And they say, How doth God know? and is there knowledge in the most
High? 
\q1

Behold, these \add are\add* the ungodly, who prosper in the
world; they increase \add in\add* riches. 
\q1

Verily I have cleansed my heart \add in\add* vain, and washed
my hands in innocency. 
\q1

For all the day long have I been plagued, and chastened every
morning.\f + \fr 73.14  \ft chastened: Heb. my chastisement was\f*
\b
\q1

If I say, I will speak thus; behold, I should offend \add against\add*
the generation of thy children. 
\q1

When I thought to know this, it \add was\add* too painful
for me;\f + \fr 73.16  \ft too…: Heb. labour in mine eyes\f* 
\q1

Until I went into the sanctuary of God; \add then\add* understood
I their end. 
\q1

Surely thou didst set them in slippery places: thou castedst them
down into destruction. 
\q1

How are they \add brought\add* into desolation, as in a moment!
they are utterly consumed with terrors. 
\q1

As a dream when \add one\add* awaketh; \add so\add*, O Lord,
when thou awakest, thou shalt despise their image. 
\b
\q1

Thus my heart was grieved, and I was pricked in my reins.
\q1

So foolish \add was\add* I, and ignorant: I was \add as\add*
a beast before thee.\f + \fr 73.22  \ft ignorant: Heb. I knew not\f*\f + \fr 73.22 
\ft before: Heb. with\f* 
\q1

Nevertheless I \add am\add* continually with thee: thou hast
holden \add me\add* by my right hand. 
\q1

Thou shalt guide me with thy counsel, and afterward receive me
\add to\add* glory. 
\q1

Whom have I in heaven \add but thee\add*? and \add there is\add*
none upon earth \add that\add* I desire beside thee. 
\q1

My flesh and my heart faileth: \add but\add* God \add is\add*
the strength of my heart, and my portion for ever.\f + \fr 73.26 
\ft strength: Heb. rock\f* 
\q1

For, lo, they that are far from thee shall perish: thou hast
destroyed all them that go a whoring from thee. 
\q1

But \add it is\add* good for me to draw near to God: I have
put my trust in the Lord \nd GOD\nd*, that I may declare all thy
works.

O God, why hast thou cast \add us\add* off for ever? \add why\add*
doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?\f + \fr 74.1 
\ft Maschil…: or, A Psalm for Asaph to give instruction\f* 
\q1

Remember thy congregation, \add which\add* thou hast purchased
of old; the rod of thine inheritance, \add which\add* thou hast redeemed;
this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.\f + \fr 74.2  \ft rod: or,
tribe\f* 
\q1

Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; \add even\add* all
\add that\add* the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary. 
\q1

Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set
up their ensigns \add for\add* signs. 
\q1

\add A man\add* was famous according as he had lifted up axes
upon the thick trees. 
\q1

But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with
axes and hammers. 
\q1

They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled \add by casting
down\add* the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.\f + \fr 74.7 
\ft They have cast…: Heb. They have sent thy sanctuary unto the fire\f*
\q1

They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned
up all the synagogues of God in the land.\f + \fr 74.8  \ft destroy: Heb.
break\f* 
\q1

We see not our signs: \add there is\add* no more any prophet: neither
\add is there\add* among us any that knoweth how long. 
\q1

O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy
blaspheme thy name for ever? 
\q1

Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck
\add it\add* out of thy bosom. 
\b
\q1

For God \add is\add* my King of old, working salvation in the
midst of the earth. 
\q1

Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the
heads of the dragons in the waters.\f + \fr 74.13  \ft divide: Heb.
break\f*\f + \fr 74.13  \ft dragons: or, whales\f* 
\q1

Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, \add and\add*
gavest him \add to be\add* meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
\q1

Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst
up mighty rivers.\f + \fr 74.15  \ft mighty…: Heb. rivers of strength\f*
\q1

The day \add is\add* thine, the night also \add is\add* thine: thou hast
prepared the light and the sun. 
\q1

Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made
summer and winter.\f + \fr 74.17  \ft made: Heb. made them\f* 
\b
\q1

Remember this, \add that\add* the enemy hath reproached, O
\nd LORD\nd*, and \add that\add* the foolish people have blasphemed
thy name. 
\q1

O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude
\add of the wicked:\add* forget not the congregation of thy poor
for ever. 
\q1

Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the
earth are full of the habitations of cruelty. 
\q1

O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy
praise thy name. 
\q1

Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish
man reproacheth thee daily. 
\q1

Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise
up against thee increaseth continually.\f + \fr 74.23  \ft increaseth: Heb.
ascendeth\f*

\d To the chief Musician, Al-taschith, A Psalm \add or\add* Song
of Asaph. 
\q1

Unto thee, O God, do we give thanks, \add unto thee\add* do we give
thanks: for \add that\add* thy name is near thy wondrous works declare.\f + \fr 75.1 
\ft Al-taschith: or, Destroy not\f*\f + \fr 75.1  \ft of: or, for\f*
\q1

When I shall receive the congregation I will judge uprightly.\f + \fr 75.2 
\ft receive…: or, take a set time\f* 
\q1

The earth and all the inhabitants thereof are dissolved: I bear
up the pillars of it. Selah. 
\q1

I said unto the fools, Deal not foolishly: and to the wicked,
Lift not up the horn: 
\q1

Lift not up your horn on high: speak \add not with\add* a stiff
neck. 
\b
\q1

For promotion \add cometh\add* neither from the east, nor from the
west, nor from the south.\f + \fr 75.6  \ft south: Heb. desert\f*
\q1

But God \add is\add* the judge: he putteth down one, and setteth
up another. 
\q1

For in the hand of the \nd LORD\nd* \add there is\add* a cup,
and the wine is red; it is full of mixture; and he poureth out of the
same: but the dregs thereof, all the wicked of the earth shall wring
\add them\add* out, \add and\add* drink \add them\add*. 
\q1

But I will declare for ever; I will sing praises to the God
of Jacob. 
\q1

All the horns of the wicked also will I cut off; \add but\add*
the horns of the righteous shall be exalted.

\d To the chief Musician on Neginoth, A Psalm \add or\add* Song of
Asaph. 
\q1

In Judah \add is\add* God known: his name \add is\add* great
in Israel.\f + \fr 76.1  \ft chief…: or, overseer\f*\f + \fr 76.1 
\ft of: or, for\f* 
\q1

In Salem also is his tabernacle, and his dwelling place in
Zion. 
\q1

There brake he the arrows of the bow, the shield, and the sword,
and the battle. Selah. 
\q1

Thou \add art\add* more glorious \add and\add* excellent than the
mountains of prey. 
\q1

The stouthearted are spoiled, they have slept their sleep:
and none of the men of might have found their hands. 
\q1

At thy rebuke, O God of Jacob, both the chariot and horse are cast into a dead
sleep. 
\b
\q1

Thou, \add even\add* thou, \add art\add* to be feared: and who may
stand in thy sight when once thou art angry? 
\q1

Thou didst cause judgment to be heard from heaven; the earth
feared, and was still, 
\q1

When God arose to judgment, to save all the meek of the earth.
Selah. 
\q1

Surely the wrath of man shall praise thee: the remainder of
wrath shalt thou restrain. 
\q1

Vow, and pay unto the \nd LORD\nd* your God: let all that be round

\ft unto him…: Heb. to fear\f* 
\q1

He shall cut off the spirit of princes: \add he is\add* terrible
to the kings of the earth.

\d To the chief Musician, to Jeduthun, A Psalm of Asaph. 
\q1

I cried unto God with my voice, \add even\add* unto God with my
voice; and he gave ear unto me.\f + \fr 77.1  \ft of: or, for\f*
\q1

In the day of my trouble I sought the Lord: my sore ran in the

\ft sore: Heb. hand\f* 
\q1

I remembered God, and was troubled: I complained, and my spirit

\q1

Thou holdest mine eyes waking: I am so troubled that I cannot
speak. 
\q1

I call to remembrance my song in the night: I commune with mine own
heart: and my spirit made diligent search. 
\q1

Will the Lord cast off for ever? and will he be favourable no more?
\q1

Is his mercy clean gone for ever? doth \add his\add* promise
fail for evermore?\f + \fr 77.8  \ft for evermore: Heb. to generation and
generation?\f* 
\q1

Hath God forgotten to be gracious? hath he in anger shut up
his tender mercies? Selah. 
\q1

And I said, This \add is\add* my infirmity: \add but I will
remember\add* the years of the right hand of the most High. 
\b
\q1

I will remember the works of the \nd LORD\nd*: surely I will
remember thy wonders of old. 
\q1

I will meditate also of all thy work, and talk of thy doings.
\q1

Thy way, O God, \add is\add* in the sanctuary: who \add is
so\add* great a God as \add our\add* God? 
\q1

Thou \add art\add* the God that doest wonders: thou hast declared
thy strength among the people. 
\q1

Thou hast with \add thine\add* arm redeemed thy people, the
sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah. 
\q1

The waters saw thee, O God, the waters saw thee; they were
afraid: the depths also were troubled. 
\q1

The clouds poured out water: the skies sent out a sound: thine

water\f* 
\q1

The voice of thy thunder \add was\add* in the heaven: the

\q1

Thy way \add is\add* in the sea, and thy path in the great
waters, and thy footsteps are not known. 
\q1

Thou leddest thy people like a flock by the hand of Moses
and Aaron.

\d Maschil of Asaph. 
\q1

Give ear, O my people, \add to\add* my law: incline your ears
to the words of my mouth.\f + \fr 78.1  \ft Maschil…: or, A Psalm for Asaph to give
instruction\f* 
\q1

I will open my mouth in a parable: I will utter dark sayings
of old: 
\q1

Which we have heard and known, and our fathers have told us.
\q1

We will not hide \add them\add* from their children, shewing
to the generation to come the praises of the \nd LORD\nd*, and his
strength, and his wonderful works that he hath done. 
\q1

For he established a testimony in Jacob, and appointed a law
in Israel, which he commanded our fathers, that they should make them
known to their children: 
\q1

That the generation to come might know \add them, even\add*
the children \add which\add* should be born; \add who\add* should
arise and declare \add them\add* to their children: 
\q1

That they might set their hope in God, and not forget the works
of God, but keep his commandments: 
\q1

And might not be as their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious
generation; a generation \add that\add* set not their heart aright,
and whose spirit was not stedfast with God.\f + \fr 78.8  \ft that…: Heb. that prepared not their
heart\f* 
\b
\q1

The children of Ephraim, \add being\add* armed, \add and\add*
carrying bows, turned back in the day of battle.\f + \fr 78.9  \ft carrying: Heb. throwing
forth\f* 
\q1

And forgat his works, and his wonders that he had shewed them.
\q1

Marvellous things did he in the sight of their fathers, in the
land of Egypt, \add in\add* the field of Zoan. 
\q1

He divided the sea, and caused them to pass through; and he made the

\q1

In the daytime also he led them with a cloud, and all the
night with a light of fire. 
\q1

He clave the rocks in the wilderness, and gave \add them\add*
drink as \add out of\add* the great depths. 
\q1

He brought streams also out of the rock, and caused waters
to run down like rivers. 
\q1

And they sinned yet more against him by provoking the most
High in the wilderness. 
\q1

And they tempted God in their heart by asking meat for their
lust. 
\q1

Yea, they spake against God; they said, Can God furnish a
table in the wilderness?\f + \fr 78.19  \ft furnish: Heb. order\f*
\q1

Behold, he smote the rock, that the waters gushed out, and the

for his people? 
\q1

Therefore the \nd LORD\nd* heard \add this\add*, and was wroth:
so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and anger also came up against
Israel; 
\q1

Because they believed not in God, and trusted not in his salvation:
\q1

Though he had commanded the clouds from above, and opened
the doors of heaven, 
\q1

And had rained down manna upon them to eat, and had given
them of the corn of heaven. 
\q1

Man did eat angels’ food: he sent them meat to the full.\f + \fr 78.25 
\ft Man…: or, Every one did eat the bread of the mighty\f* 
\q1

He caused an east wind to blow in the heaven: and by his power
he brought in the south wind.\f + \fr 78.26  \ft to blow: Heb. to
go\f* 
\q1

He rained flesh also upon them as dust, and feathered fowls
like as the sand of the sea:\f + \fr 78.27  \ft feathered…: Heb. fowl of
wing\f* 
\q1

And he let \add it\add* fall in the midst of their camp, round
about their habitations. 
\q1

They were not estranged from their lust. But while their meat
\add was\add* yet in their mouths, 
\q1

The wrath of God came upon them, and slew the fattest of them, and smote
down the chosen \add men\add* of Israel.\f + \fr 78.31  \ft smote…: Heb. made to
bow\f*\f + \fr 78.31  \ft chosen…: or, young men\f* 
\q1

For all this they sinned still, and believed not for his wondrous
works. 
\q1

Therefore their days did he consume in vanity, and their years
in trouble. 
\q1

When he slew them, then they sought him: and they returned
and enquired early after God. 
\q1

And they remembered that God \add was\add* their rock, and the
high God their redeemer. 
\q1

Nevertheless they did flatter him with their mouth, and they
lied unto him with their tongues. 
\q1

For their heart was not right with him, neither were they
stedfast in his covenant. 
\q1

But he, \add being\add* full of compassion, forgave \add their\add*
iniquity, and destroyed \add them\add* not: yea, many a time turned
he his anger away, and did not stir up all his wrath. 
\q1

For he remembered that they \add were but\add* flesh; a wind
that passeth away, and cometh not again. 
\b
\q1

How oft did they provoke him in the wilderness, \add and\add*
grieve him in the desert!\f + \fr 78.40  \ft provoke: or, rebel against\f*
\q1

Yea, they turned back and tempted God, and limited the Holy
One of Israel. 
\q1

They remembered not his hand, \add nor\add* the day when he
delivered them from the enemy.\f + \fr 78.42  \ft from…: or, from
affliction\f* 
\q1

How he had wrought his signs in Egypt, and his wonders in the
field of Zoan:\f + \fr 78.43  \ft wrought: Heb. set\f* 
\q1

And had turned their rivers into blood; and their floods,
that they could not drink. 
\q1

He sent divers sorts of flies among them, which devoured them; and
frogs, which destroyed them. 
\q1

He gave also their increase unto the caterpiller, and their
labour unto the locust. 
\q1

He destroyed their vines with hail, and their sycomore trees
with frost.\f + \fr 78.47  \ft destroyed: Heb. killed\f*\f + \fr 78.47 
\ft frost: or, great hailstones\f* 
\q1

He gave up their cattle also to the hail, and their flocks
to hot thunderbolts.\f + \fr 78.48  \ft gave…: Heb. shut up\f*\f + \fr 78.48 
\ft hot…: or, lightnings\f* 
\q1

He cast upon them the fierceness of his anger, wrath, and
indignation, and trouble, by sending evil angels \add among them\add*.
\q1

He made a way to his anger; he spared not their soul from
death, but gave their life over to the pestilence;\f + \fr 78.50 
\ft He made…: Heb. He weighed a path\f*\f + \fr 78.50  \ft life…: or, beasts to the
murrain\f* 
\q1

And smote all the firstborn in Egypt; the chief of \add their\add*
strength in the tabernacles of Ham: 
\q1

But made his own people to go forth like sheep, and guided
them in the wilderness like a flock. 
\q1

And he led them on safely, so that they feared not: but the
sea overwhelmed their enemies.\f + \fr 78.53  \ft overwhelmed: Heb.
covered\f* 
\q1

And he brought them to the border of his sanctuary, \add even
to\add* this mountain, \add which\add* his right hand had purchased.
\q1

He cast out the heathen also before them, and divided them an
inheritance by line, and made the tribes of Israel to dwell in their
tents. 
\q1

But turned back, and dealt unfaithfully like their fathers:
they were turned aside like a deceitful bow. 
\q1

For they provoked him to anger with their high places, and moved him to
jealousy with their graven images. 
\q1

When God heard \add this\add*, he was wroth, and greatly abhorred
 Israel: 
\q1

And delivered his strength into captivity, and his glory into the
enemy’s hand. 
\q1

He gave his people over also unto the sword; and was wroth
with his inheritance. 
\q1

The fire consumed their young men; and their maidens were not given to
marriage.\f + \fr 78.63  \ft given…: Heb. praised\f* 
\q1

Their priests fell by the sword; and their widows made no
lamentation. 
\q1

Then the Lord awaked as one out of sleep, \add and\add* like a mighty
man that shouteth by reason of wine. 
\q1

And he smote his enemies in the hinder parts: he put them to a
perpetual reproach. 
\q1

Moreover he refused the tabernacle of Joseph, and chose not the
tribe of Ephraim: 
\q1

But chose the tribe of Judah, the mount Zion which he loved.
\q1

And he built his sanctuary like high \add palaces\add*, like the
earth which he hath established for ever.\f + \fr 78.69  \ft established: Heb.
founded\f* 
\q1

He chose David also his servant, and took him from the sheepfolds:
\q1

From following the ewes great with young he brought him to
feed Jacob his people, and Israel his inheritance.\f + \fr 78.71 
\ft following: Heb. after\f* 
\q1

So he fed them according to the integrity of his heart; and
guided them by the skilfulness of his hands.

\d A Psalm of Asaph. 
\q1

O God, the heathen are come into thine inheritance; thy holy
temple have they defiled; they have laid Jerusalem on heaps.\f + \fr 79.1 
\ft of: or, for\f* 
\q1

The dead bodies of thy servants have they given \add to be\add*
meat unto the fowls of the heaven, the flesh of thy saints unto the
beasts of the earth. 
\q1

Their blood have they shed like water round about Jerusalem; and
\add there was\add* none to bury \add them\add*. 
\q1

We are become a reproach to our neighbours, a scorn and derision
to them that are round about us. 
\q1

How long, \nd LORD\nd*? wilt thou be angry for ever? shall thy
jealousy burn like fire? 
\b
\q1

Pour out thy wrath upon the heathen that have not known thee, and upon the
kingdoms that have not called upon thy name. 
\q1

For they have devoured Jacob, and laid waste his dwelling place.
\q1

O remember not against us former iniquities: let thy tender
mercies speedily prevent us: for we are brought very low.\f + \fr 79.8 
\ft former…: or, the iniquities of them that were before us\f* 
\q1

Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of thy name:
and deliver us, and purge away our sins, for thy name’s sake. 
\q1

Wherefore should the heathen say, Where \add is\add* their
God? let him be known among the heathen in our sight \add by\add*
the revenging of the blood of thy servants \add which is\add* shed.\f + \fr 79.10 
\ft revenging: Heb. vengeance\f* 
\q1

Let the sighing of the prisoner come before thee; according to the
greatness of thy power preserve thou those that are appointed to
die;\f + \fr 79.11  \ft thy…: Heb. thine arm\f*\f + \fr 79.11  \ft preserve…: Heb. reserve the children of
death\f* 
\q1

And render unto our neighbours sevenfold into their bosom
their reproach, wherewith they have reproached thee, O Lord. 
\q1

So we thy people and sheep of thy pasture will give thee thanks
for ever: we will shew forth thy praise to all generations.\f + \fr 79.13 
\ft to all…: Heb. to generation and generation\f*

\d To the chief Musician upon Shoshannim-eduth, A Psalm of Asaph.
\q1

Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, thou that leadest Joseph like a
flock; thou that dwellest \add between\add* the cherubims, shine
forth.\f + \fr 80.1  \ft of: or, for\f* 
\q1

Before Ephraim and Benjamin and Manasseh stir up thy strength,
and come \add and\add* save us.\f + \fr 80.2  \ft come…: Heb. come for salvation to
us\f* 
\q1

Turn us again, O God, and cause thy face to shine; and we shall be
saved. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* God of hosts, how long wilt thou be angry against the
prayer of thy people?\f + \fr 80.4  \ft be…: Heb. smoke\f* 
\q1

Thou feedest them with the bread of tears; and givest them
tears to drink in great measure. 
\q1

Thou makest us a strife unto our neighbours: and our enemies
laugh among themselves. 
\q1

Turn us again, O God of hosts, and cause thy face to shine;
and we shall be saved. 
\b
\q1

Thou hast brought a vine out of Egypt: thou hast cast out the
heathen, and planted it. 
\q1

Thou preparedst \add room\add* before it, and didst cause it to take
deep root, and it filled the land. 
\q1

The hills were covered with the shadow of it, and the boughs thereof
\add were like\add* the goodly cedars.\f + \fr 80.10  \ft goodly…: Heb. cedars of
God\f* 
\q1

She sent out her boughs unto the sea, and her branches unto the
river. 
\q1

Why hast thou \add then\add* broken down her hedges, so that all they which
pass by the way do pluck her? 
\q1

The boar out of the wood doth waste it, and the wild beast
of the field doth devour it. 
\q1

And the vineyard which thy right hand hath planted, and the
branch \add that\add* thou madest strong for thyself. 
\q1

\add It is\add* burned with fire, \add it is\add* cut down:
they perish at the rebuke of thy countenance. 
\q1

Let thy hand be upon the man of thy right hand, upon the son
of man \add whom\add* thou madest strong for thyself. 
\q1

So will not we go back from thee: quicken us, and we will
call upon thy name. 
\q1

Turn us again, O \nd LORD\nd* God of hosts, cause thy face
to shine; and we shall be saved.

\d To the chief Musician upon Gittith, \add A Psalm\add* of Asaph.
\q1

Sing aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the
God of Jacob.\f + \fr 81.1  \ft of Asaph: or, for Asaph\f* 
\q1

Take a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp
with the psaltery. 
\q1

Blow up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed,
on our solemn feast day. 
\q1

For this \add was\add* a statute for Israel, \add and\add* a
law of the God of Jacob. 
\q1

This he ordained in Joseph \add for\add* a testimony, when he went
out through the land of Egypt: \add where\add* I heard a language
\add that\add* I understood not.\f + \fr 81.5  \ft through: or, against\f*
\q1

I removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered
from the pots.\f + \fr 81.6  \ft were…: Heb. passed away\f* 
\q1

Thou calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered
thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters
of Meribah. Selah.\f + \fr 81.7  \ft Meribah: or, Strife\f* 
\b
\q1

There shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship
any strange god. 
\q1

I \add am\add* the \nd LORD\nd* thy God, which brought thee out of the
land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it. 
\q1

But my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
\q1

So I gave them up unto their own hearts’ lust: \add and\add*
they walked in their own counsels.\f + \fr 81.12  \ft unto…: or, to the hardness of their hearts, or,
imagination\f* 
\q1

Oh that my people had hearkened unto me, \add and\add* Israel
had walked in my ways! 
\q1

I should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand
against their adversaries. 
\q1

The haters of the \nd LORD\nd* should have submitted themselves unto him: but their
time should have endured for ever.\f + \fr 81.15  \ft submitted…: or, yielded feigned obedience: Heb.
lied\f* 
\q1

He should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat:
and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.\f + \fr 81.16 
\ft finest…: Heb. fat of wheat\f*

God standeth in the congregation of the mighty; he judgeth
among the gods.\f + \fr 82.1  \ft of Asaph: or, for Asaph\f* 
\q1

How long will ye judge unjustly, and accept the persons of the
wicked? Selah. 
\q1

Defend the poor and fatherless: do justice to the afflicted
and needy.\f + \fr 82.3  \ft Defend: Heb. Judge\f* 
\q1

Deliver the poor and needy: rid \add them\add* out of the hand
of the wicked. 
\q1

They know not, neither will they understand; they walk on in
darkness: all the foundations of the earth are out of course.\f + \fr 82.5 
\ft out…: Heb. moved\f* 
\b
\q1

I have said, Ye \add are\add* gods; and all of you \add are\add*
children of the most High. 
\q1

But ye shall die like men, and fall like one of the princes.
\q1
Arise, O God, judge the earth: for thou shalt inherit all nations.

\d A Song \add or\add* Psalm of Asaph. 
\q1

Keep not thou silence, O God: hold not thy peace, and be not
still, O God.\f + \fr 83.1  \ft of Asaph: or, for Asaph\f* 
\q1

For, lo, thine enemies make a tumult: and they that hate thee have lifted
up the head. 
\q1

They have taken crafty counsel against thy people, and consulted
against thy hidden ones. 
\q1

They have said, Come, and let us cut them off from \add being\add*
a nation; that the name of Israel may be no more in remembrance.
\q1

For they have consulted together with one consent: they are
confederate against thee:\f + \fr 83.5  \ft consent: Heb. heart\f*
\q1

Assur also is joined with them: they have holpen the children
of Lot. Selah.\f + \fr 83.8  \ft holpen: Heb. been an arm to\f* 
\b
\q1

Do unto them as \add unto\add* the Midianites; as \add to\add*
Sisera, as \add to\add* Jabin, at the brook of Kison: 
\q1

\add Which\add* perished at Endor: they became \add as\add*
dung for the earth. 
\q1

Make their nobles like Oreb, and like Zeeb: yea, all their
princes as Zebah, and as Zalmunna: 
\q1

Who said, Let us take to ourselves the houses of God in possession.
\q1

O my God, make them like a wheel; as the stubble before the
wind. 
\q1

So persecute them with thy tempest, and make them afraid with thy
storm. 
\q1

Fill their faces with shame; that they may seek thy name,
O \nd LORD\nd*. 
\q1

Let them be confounded and troubled for ever; yea, let them be put to
shame, and perish: 
\q1

That \add men\add* may know that thou, whose name alone \add is\add*
\nd JEHOVAH\nd*, \add art\add* the most high over all the earth.

\d To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm for the sons of Korah.
\q1

How amiable \add are\add* thy tabernacles, O \nd LORD\nd* of
hosts!\f + \fr 84.1  \ft for the sons: or, of the sons\f* 
\q1

My soul longeth, yea, even fainteth for the courts of the \nd LORD\nd*:
my heart and my flesh crieth out for the living God. 
\q1

Yea, the sparrow hath found an house, and the swallow a nest
for herself, where she may lay her young, \add even\add* thine altars,
O \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, my King, and my God. 
\q1

Blessed \add are\add* they that dwell in thy house: they will be still
praising thee. Selah. 
\q1

Blessed \add is\add* the man whose strength \add is\add* in thee; in whose
heart \add are\add* the ways \add of them\add*. 
\q1

\add Who\add* passing through the valley of Baca make it a
well; the rain also filleth the pools.\f + \fr 84.6  \ft Baca…: or, mulberry trees make him a well,
etc\f*\f + \fr 84.6  \ft filleth: Heb. covereth\f* 
\q1

They go from strength to strength, \add every one of them\add*
in Zion appeareth before God.\f + \fr 84.7  \ft strength to…: or, company to
company\f* 
\b
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* God of hosts, hear my prayer: give ear, O God
of Jacob. Selah. 
\q1

Behold, O God our shield, and look upon the face of thine anointed.
\q1

For a day in thy courts \add is\add* better than a thousand.
I had rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God, than to dwell
in the tents of wickedness.\f + \fr 84.10  \ft I had…: Heb. I would choose rather to sit at the
threshold\f* 
\q1

For the \nd LORD\nd* God \add is\add* a sun and shield: the
\nd LORD\nd* will give grace and glory: no good \add thing\add* will he
withhold from them that walk uprightly. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* of hosts, blessed \add is\add* the man that
trusteth in thee.

\d To the chief Musician, A Psalm for the sons of Korah. 
\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, thou hast been favourable unto thy land: thou hast brought
back the captivity of Jacob.\f + \fr 85.1  \ft for the sons: or, of the
sons\f*\f + \fr 85.1  \ft favourable: or, well pleased\f* 
\q1

Thou hast forgiven the iniquity of thy people, thou hast covered
all their sin. Selah. 
\q1

Thou hast taken away all thy wrath: thou hast turned \add thyself\add*
from the fierceness of thine anger.\f + \fr 85.3  \ft thyself…: or, thine anger from waxing
hot\f* 
\q1

Turn us, O God of our salvation, and cause thine anger toward us to
cease. 
\q1

Wilt thou be angry with us for ever? wilt thou draw out thine
anger to all generations? 
\q1

Wilt thou not revive us again: that thy people may rejoice in thee?
\q1

Shew us thy mercy, O \nd LORD\nd*, and grant us thy salvation.
\b
\q1

I will hear what God the \nd LORD\nd* will speak: for he will
speak peace unto his people, and to his saints: but let them not turn
again to folly. 
\q1

Surely his salvation \add is\add* nigh them that fear him; that
glory may dwell in our land. 
\q1

Mercy and truth are met together; righteousness and peace
have kissed \add each other\add*. 
\q1

Truth shall spring out of the earth; and righteousness shall look
down from heaven. 
\q1

Righteousness shall go before him; and shall set \add us\add*
in the way of his steps.

Bow down thine ear, O \nd LORD\nd*, hear me: for I \add am\add*
poor and needy.\f + \fr 86.1  \ft A Prayer…: or, A Prayer, being a Psalm of
David\f* 
\q1

Preserve my soul; for I \add am\add* holy: O thou my God, save
thy servant that trusteth in thee.\f + \fr 86.2  \ft holy: or, one whom thou
favourest\f* 
\q1

Be merciful unto me, O Lord: for I cry unto thee daily.\f + \fr 86.3 
\ft daily: or, all the day\f* 
\q1

Rejoice the soul of thy servant: for unto thee, O Lord, do I lift
up my soul. 
\q1

For thou, Lord, \add art\add* good, and ready to forgive; and
plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee. 
\q1

Give ear, O \nd LORD\nd*, unto my prayer; and attend to the
voice of my supplications. 
\q1

In the day of my trouble I will call upon thee: for thou wilt
answer me. 
\b
\q1

Among the gods \add there is\add* none like unto thee, O Lord; neither
\add are there any works\add* like unto thy works. 
\q1

All nations whom thou hast made shall come and worship before
thee, O Lord; and shall glorify thy name. 
\q1

For thou \add art\add* great, and doest wondrous things: thou
\add art\add* God alone. 
\q1

Teach me thy way, O \nd LORD\nd*; I will walk in thy truth:
unite my heart to fear thy name. 
\q1

I will praise thee, O Lord my God, with all my heart: and I will
glorify thy name for evermore. 
\q1

For great \add is\add* thy mercy toward me: and thou hast
delivered my soul from the lowest hell.\f + \fr 86.13  \ft hell: or,
grave\f* 
\q1

O God, the proud are risen against me, and the assemblies
of violent \add men\add* have sought after my soul; and have not
set thee before them.\f + \fr 86.14  \ft violent: Heb. terrible\f*
\q1

But thou, O Lord, \add art\add* a God full of compassion,
and gracious, longsuffering, and plenteous in mercy and truth. 
\q1

O turn unto me, and have mercy upon me; give thy strength
unto thy servant, and save the son of thine handmaid. 
\q1

Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see
\add it\add*, and be ashamed: because thou, \nd LORD\nd*, hast holpen
me, and comforted me.

\d A Psalm \add or\add* Song for the sons of Korah. 
\q1

His foundation \add is\add* in the holy mountains.\f + \fr 87.1 
\ft for the sons: or, of the sons\f* 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* loveth the gates of Zion more than all the
dwellings of Jacob. 
\q1

Glorious things are spoken of thee, O city of God. Selah. 
\b
\q1

I will make mention of Rahab and Babylon to them that know
me: behold Philistia, and Tyre, with Ethiopia; this \add man\add*
was born there. 
\q1

And of Zion it shall be said, This and that man was born in her: and the
highest himself shall establish her. 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* shall count, when he writeth up the people,
\add that\add* this \add man\add* was born there. Selah. 
\q1

As well the singers as the players on instruments \add shall be
there:\add* all my springs \add are\add* in thee.

\d A Song \add or\add* Psalm for the sons of Korah, to the chief
Musician upon Mahalath Leannoth, Maschil of Heman the Ezrahite. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd* God of my salvation, I have cried day \add and\add*
night before thee:\f + \fr 88.1  \ft for the sons: or, of the sons\f*\f + \fr 88.1 
\ft Maschil…: or, A Psalm of Heman the Ezrahite, giving instruction\f*
\q1

Let my prayer come before thee: incline thine ear unto my cry;
\q1

For my soul is full of troubles: and my life draweth nigh unto the
grave. 
\q1

I am counted with them that go down into the pit: I am as a
man \add that hath\add* no strength: 
\q1

Free among the dead, like the slain that lie in the grave,
whom thou rememberest no more: and they are cut off from thy hand.\f + \fr 88.5 
\ft from: or, by\f* 
\q1

Thou hast laid me in the lowest pit, in darkness, in the deeps.
\q1

Thy wrath lieth hard upon me, and thou hast afflicted \add me\add*
with all thy waves. Selah. 
\q1

Thou hast put away mine acquaintance far from me; thou hast
made me an abomination unto them: \add I am\add* shut up, and I cannot come
forth. 
\q1

Mine eye mourneth by reason of affliction: \nd LORD\nd*, I have
called daily upon thee, I have stretched out my hands unto thee.
\b
\q1

Wilt thou shew wonders to the dead? shall the dead arise 
\add and\add* praise thee? Selah. 
\q1

Shall thy lovingkindness be declared in the grave? \add or\add*
thy faithfulness in destruction? 
\q1

Shall thy wonders be known in the dark? and thy righteousness
in the land of forgetfulness? 
\q1

But unto thee have I cried, O \nd LORD\nd*; and in the morning
shall my prayer prevent thee. 
\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, why castest thou off my soul? \add why\add*
hidest thou thy face from me? 
\q1

I \add am\add* afflicted and ready to die from \add my\add*
youth up: \add while\add* I suffer thy terrors I am distracted. 
\q1

Thy fierce wrath goeth over me; thy terrors have cut me off.
\q1

They came round about me daily like water; they compassed
me about together.\f + \fr 88.17  \ft daily: or, all the day\f* 
\q1

Lover and friend hast thou put far from me, \add and\add*
mine acquaintance into darkness.

I will sing of the mercies of the \nd LORD\nd* for ever: with my
mouth will I make known thy faithfulness to all generations.\f + \fr 89.1 
\ft Maschil…: or, A Psalm for Ethan the Ezrahite, to give instruction\f*\f + \fr 89.1 
\ft to all…: Heb. to generation and generation\f* 
\q1

For I have said, Mercy shall be built up for ever: thy faithfulness
shalt thou establish in the very heavens. 
\q1

I have made a covenant with my chosen, I have sworn unto David
my servant, 
\q1

Thy seed will I establish for ever, and build up thy throne
to all generations. Selah. 
\b
\q1

And the heavens shall praise thy wonders, O \nd LORD\nd*: thy
faithfulness also in the congregation of the saints. 
\q1

For who in the heaven can be compared unto the \nd LORD\nd*?
\add who\add* among the sons of the mighty can be likened unto the
\nd LORD\nd*? 
\q1

God is greatly to be feared in the assembly of the saints,
and to be had in reverence of all \add them that are\add* about him.
\q1

O 
d LORD
d* God of hosts, who \add is\add* a strong

Whatsoever the \nd LORD\nd* pleased, \add that\add* did he in

He causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth;

Who smote the firstborn of Egypt, both of man and beast.\f + \fr 135.8

\q1

Sihon king of the Amorites, and Og king of Bashan, and all the

\q1

And gave their land \add for\add* an heritage, an heritage

\q1

Thy name, O \nd LORD\nd*, \add endureth\add* for ever; \add and\add*

\q1

For the \nd LORD\nd* will judge his people, and he will repent

\b
\q1

The idols of the heathen \add are\add* silver and gold, the

\q1

They have ears, but they hear not; neither is there \add any\add*

\q1

They that make them are like unto them: \add so is\add* every one that

\q1

Bless the 
d LORD
d*, O house of Israel: bless the 
d LORD
d*,
O house of Aaron: 
\q1

Bless the 
d LORD
d*, O house of Levi: ye that fear the

d LORD
d*, bless the 
d LORD
d*. 
\q1

Blessed be the 
d LORD
d* out of Zion, which dwelleth at
Jerusalem. Praise ye the 
d LORD
d*.

O give thanks unto the \nd LORD\nd*; for \add he is\add* good:
for his mercy \add endureth\add* for ever. 
\q1

O give thanks unto the God of gods: for his mercy \add endureth\add*
for ever. 
\q1

O give thanks to the Lord of lords: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

\q1

To him who alone doeth great wonders: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

\q1

To him that by wisdom made the heavens: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

\q1

To him that stretched out the earth above the waters: for his

\q1

The sun to rule by day: for his mercy \add endureth\add* for

The moon and stars to rule by night: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

\q1

To him that smote Egypt in their firstborn: for his mercy

\q1

With a strong hand, and with a stretched out arm: for his

\q1

To him which divided the Red sea into parts: for his mercy

\q1

And made Israel to pass through the midst of it: for his mercy
\add endureth\add* for ever: 
\q1

But overthrew Pharaoh and his host in the Red sea: for his

\q1

To him which led his people through the wilderness: for his

\q1

And slew famous kings: for his mercy \add endureth\add* for

\q1

\add Even\add* an heritage unto Israel his servant: for his

\b
\q1

And hath redeemed us from our enemies: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

\q1

Who giveth food to all flesh: for his mercy \add endureth\add*
for ever. 
\q1

O give thanks unto the God of heaven: for his mercy \add endureth\add*

By the rivers of Babylon, there we sat down, yea, we wept,

\q1

We hanged our harps upon the willows in the midst thereof.
\q1

For there they that carried us away captive required of us a
