Sing us \add one\add* of the songs of Zion.\f + \fr 137.3  \ft a song: Heb. the words of a
song\f*\f + \fr 137.3  \ft wasted…: Heb. laid us on heaps\f* 
\q1

How shall we sing the \nd LORD’s\nd* song in a strange land?\f + \fr 137.4

\q1

If I forget thee, O Jerusalem, let my right hand forget \add her

\q1

If I do not remember thee, let my tongue cleave to the roof of my

\b
\q1

Remember, O \nd LORD\nd*, the children of Edom in the day of

\q1

O daughter of Babylon, who art to be destroyed; happy \add shall he

\ft destroyed: Heb. wasted\f*\f + \fr 137.8  \ft rewardeth…: Heb. recompenseth unto thee thy deed which thou didst to
us\f* 
\q1

Happy \add shall he be\add*, that taketh and dasheth thy little

\d \add A Psalm\add* of David. 
\q1

I will praise thee with my whole heart: before the gods will I sing

\q1

I will worship toward thy holy temple, and praise thy name
for thy lovingkindness and for thy truth: for thou hast magnified
thy word above all thy name. 
\q1

In the day when I cried thou answeredst me, \add and\add* strengthenedst me
\add with\add* strength in my soul. 
\q1

All the kings of the earth shall praise thee, O \nd LORD\nd*,
when they hear the words of thy mouth. 
\q1

Yea, they shall sing in the ways of the \nd LORD\nd*: for great
\add is\add* the glory of the \nd LORD\nd*. 
\b
\q1

Though the \nd LORD\nd* \add be\add* high, yet hath he respect
unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off. 
\q1

Though I walk in the midst of trouble, thou wilt revive me: thou shalt stretch
forth thine hand against the wrath of mine enemies, and thy right
hand shall save me. 
\q1

The 
d LORD
d* will perfect \add that which\add* concerneth me: thy
mercy, O 
d LORD
d*, \add endureth\add* for ever: forsake  not the
works of thine own hands.

\d To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. 
\q1

O \nd LORD\nd*, thou hast searched me, and known \add me\add*.
\q1

Thou knowest my downsitting and mine uprising, thou understandest
my thought afar off. 
\q1

Thou compassest my path and my lying down, and art acquainted
\add with\add* all my ways.\f + \fr 139.3  \ft compassest: or, winnowest\f*
\q1

For \add there is\add* not a word in my tongue, \add but\add*,
lo, O \nd LORD\nd*, thou knowest it altogether. 
\q1

Thou hast beset me behind and before, and laid thine hand upon me.
\q1

\add Such\add* knowledge \add is\add* too wonderful for me; it is
high, I cannot \add attain\add* unto it. 
\b
\q1

Whither shall I go from thy spirit? or whither shall I flee
from thy presence? 
\q1

If I ascend up into heaven, thou \add art\add* there: if I make my
bed in hell, behold, thou \add art there\add*. 
\q1

Even there shall thy hand lead me, and thy right hand shall
hold me. 
\q1

If I say, Surely the darkness shall cover me; even the night

\q1

Yea, the darkness hideth not from thee; but the night shineth

\ft the darkness and…: Heb. as is the darkness, so is the light\f*
\q1

For thou hast possessed my reins: thou hast covered me in my
mother’s womb. 
\q1

I will praise thee; for I am fearfully \add and\add* wonderfully

knoweth right well.\f + \fr 139.14  \ft right…: Heb. greatly\f* 
\q1

My substance was not hid from thee, when I was made in secret,
\add and\add* curiously wrought in the lowest parts of the earth.\f + \fr 139.15 
\ft substance: or, strength, or, body\f* 
\q1

Thine eyes did see my substance, yet being unperfect; and in thy
book all \add my members\add* were written, \add which\add* in continuance

\ft all…: Heb. all of them\f*\f + \fr 139.16  \ft which…: or, what days they should be
fashioned\f* 
\b
\q1

How precious also are thy thoughts unto me, O God! how great

\q1

\add If\add* I should count them, they are more in number

\q1

Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God: depart from me therefore, ye

\q1

For they speak against thee wickedly, \add and\add* thine

\q1

Do not I hate them, O \nd LORD\nd*, that hate thee? and am not I

\q1

I hate them with perfect hatred: I count them mine enemies.
\q1

Search me, O God, and know my heart: try me, and know my thoughts:
\q1

And see if \add there be any\add* wicked way in me, and lead

Deliver me, O \nd LORD\nd*, from the evil man: preserve me from the

\q1

Which imagine mischiefs in \add their\add* heart; continually

\q1

They have sharpened their tongues like a serpent; adders’ poison
\add is\add* under their lips. Selah. 
\q1

Keep me, O \nd LORD\nd*, from the hands of the wicked; preserve
 me from the violent man; who have purposed to overthrow my goings.
\q1

The proud have hid a snare for me, and cords; they have spread

\q1

I said unto the 
d LORD
d*, Thou \add art\add* my God: hear
the voice of my supplications, O 
d LORD
d*. 
\q1

O \nd GOD\nd* the Lord, the strength of my salvation, thou hast

\b
\q1

Grant not, O \nd LORD\nd*, the desires of the wicked: further

\add As for\add* the head of those that compass me about, let the

Let burning coals fall upon them: let them be cast into the

Let not an evil speaker be established in the earth: evil

to his overthrow\f* 
\q1

I know that the \nd LORD\nd* will maintain the cause of the

\q1

\d A Psalm of David. 
\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, I cry unto thee: make haste unto me; give ear

\q1

Let my prayer be set forth before thee \add as\add* incense;
\add and\add* the lifting up of my hands \add as\add* the evening

\q1

Set a watch, O \nd LORD\nd*, before my mouth; keep the door

\q1

Incline not my heart to \add any\add* evil thing, to practise

\b
\q1

Let the righteous smite me; \add it shall be\add* a kindness:

shall not break my head: for yet my prayer also \add shall be\add*

etc\f* 
\q1

When their judges are overthrown in stony places, they shall

\q1

Our bones are scattered at the grave’s mouth, as when one cutteth

But mine eyes \add are\add* unto thee, O \nd GOD\nd* the Lord:

\q1

\d Maschil of David; A Prayer when he was in the cave. 
\q1

I cried unto the \nd LORD\nd* with my voice; with my voice

\q1

I poured out my complaint before him; I shewed before him my

\q1

When my spirit was overwhelmed within me, then thou knewest

\q1

I looked on \add my\add* right hand, and beheld, but \add there

\q1

I cried unto thee, O \nd LORD\nd*: I said, Thou \add art\add*

\q1

\q1

Hear my prayer, O \nd LORD\nd*, give ear to my supplications:

And enter not into judgment with thy servant: for in thy sight

\q1

For the enemy hath persecuted my soul; he hath smitten my life

\q1

Therefore is my spirit overwhelmed  within me; my heart within

\q1

I remember the days of old; I meditate on all thy works; I

\q1

I stretch forth my hands unto thee: my soul \add thirsteth\add*

\b
\q1

Hear me speedily, O \nd LORD\nd*: my spirit faileth: hide not thy

\q1

\q1

\q1

\q1

Quicken me, O \nd LORD\nd*, for thy name’s sake: for thy righteousness’

\q1

And of thy mercy cut off mine enemies, and destroy all them that
afflict my soul: for I \add am\add* thy servant.

\d \add A Psalm\add* of David. 
\q1

Blessed \add be\add* the \nd LORD\nd* my strength, which teacheth

\q1

My goodness, and my fortress; my high tower, and my deliverer;

\q1

\nd LORD\nd*, what \add is\add* man, that thou takest knowledge of him!

\q1

Man is like to vanity: his days \add are\add* as a shadow that passeth

\q1

Bow thy heavens, O \nd LORD\nd*, and come down: touch the mountains,

\q1

\q1

\q1

Whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand \add is\add*

\b
\q1

I will sing a new song unto thee, O God: upon a psaltery \add and\add*

\q1

\add It is he\add* that giveth salvation unto kings: who delivereth

\q1

Rid me, and deliver me from the hand of strange children,
whose mouth speaketh vanity, and their right hand \add is\add* a right

\q1

That our sons \add may be\add* as plants grown up in their

\q1

\add That\add* our garners \add may be\add* full, affording

\q1

\add That\add* our oxen \add may be\add* strong to labour;
\add that there be\add* no breaking in, nor going out; that \add there
be\add* no complaining in our streets.\f + \fr 144.14  \ft strong…: Heb. able to bear burdens, or, loaden with
flesh\f* 
\q1

Happy \add is that\add* people, that is in such a case: \add yea\add*,
happy \add is that\add* people, whose God \add is\add* the \nd LORD\nd*.

\d David’s \add Psalm\add* of praise. 
\q1

I will extol thee, my God, O king; and I will bless thy name

\q1

Every day will I bless thee; and I will praise thy name for

\q1

Great \add is\add* the \nd LORD\nd*, and greatly to be praised;

search\f*

One generation shall praise thy works to another, and shall

\q1

I will speak of the glorious honour of thy majesty, and of thy

And \add men\add* shall speak of the might of thy terrible acts:

\q1

They shall abundantly utter the memory of thy great goodness,

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* gracious, and full of compassion;

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* good to all: and his tender mercies

\b
\q1

All thy works shall praise thee, O \nd LORD\nd*; and thy saints

\q1

To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, and the

\q1

Thy kingdom \add is\add* an everlasting kingdom, and thy dominion
\add endureth\add* throughout all generations.\f + \fr 145.13  \ft an…: Heb. a kingdom of all

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* upholdeth all that fall, and raiseth up all
\add those that be\add* bowed down. 
\q1

The eyes of all wait upon thee; and thou givest them their

\q1

Thou openest thine hand, and satisfiest the desire of every living

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* righteous in all his ways, and

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* \add is\add* nigh unto all them that call

\q1

He will fulfil the desire of them that fear him: he also will

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* preserveth all them that love him: but all the

\q1

My mouth shall speak the praise of the \nd LORD\nd*: and let all

Praise ye the 
d LORD
d*. Praise the 
d LORD
d*, O my soul.  +  r 146.1 
 t Praise ye…: Heb. Hallelujah * 
\q1

While I live will I praise the \nd LORD\nd*: I will sing praises

\q1

\q1

His breath goeth forth, he returneth to his earth; in that very

\b
\q1

Which made heaven, and earth, the sea, and all that therein
\add is:\add* which keepeth truth for ever: 
\q1

Which executeth judgment for the oppressed: which giveth food

\q1

The 
d LORD
d* openeth \add the eyes of\add* the blind: the

d LORD
d* raiseth them that are bowed down: the 
d LORD
d* loveth
the righteous: 
\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* preserveth the strangers; he relieveth the

\q1

The 
d LORD
d* shall reign for ever, \add even\add* thy
God, O Zion, unto all generations. Praise ye the 
d LORD
d*.

Praise ye the \nd LORD\nd*: for \add it is\add* good to sing

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* doth build up Jerusalem: he gathereth together

\q1

He healeth the broken in heart, and bindeth up their wounds.\f + \fr 147.3

He telleth the number of the stars; he calleth them all by

Great \add is\add* our Lord, and of great power: his understanding

\q1

The \nd LORD\nd* lifteth up the meek: he casteth the wicked

\q1

Who covereth the heaven with clouds, who prepareth rain for the

\b
\q1

Praise the \nd LORD\nd*, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Zion.

For he hath strengthened the bars of thy gates; he hath blessed

\q1

He maketh peace \add in\add* thy borders, \add and\add* filleth
 thee with the finest of the wheat.\f + \fr 147.14  \ft He…: Heb. Who maketh thy border

\q1

He sendeth forth his commandment \add upon\add* earth: his

\q1
